actions.text: Referred to House Committee on International Relations.
Reported to House from the Committee on International Relations with amendment, H. Rept. 94-1416.
Measure called up under motion to suspend rules and pass in House.
Referred to Senate Committee on Foreign Relations.

official_title: A bill to provide for termination of investment insurance and guaranties issued by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation in any case in which the investor makes a significant payment to an official of a foreign government for the purpose of influencing the actions of such government.

summary.text: Amends the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 to direct the Overseas Private Investment Corporation to issue regulations under which investment insurance and guaranties issued by such Corporation shall be terminated upon a determination that an investor has made a significant payment to an official or political party of a foreign government to influence the actions of such government.

titles.title: A bill to provide for termination of investment insurance and guaranties issued by the Overseas Private Investment Corporation in any case in which the investor makes a significant payment to an official of a foreign government for the purpose of influencing the actions of such government.
